intro: Gnaphalium rubriflorum, commonly known as the redflower everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red, with a distinctive reddish hue in the center. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its fibrous roots and herbaceous growth habit make it a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
